intro: Relbunium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading relbunium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes the carrot and parsley family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves that are typically divided into several linear segments. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, a common floral structure in the Apiaceae family. Relbunium diffusum is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along the edges of woodlands. It is generally a low-growing plant that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
